intro: Orthodon cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
